questions.question: Which one of the following statements is correct regarding placing a device on your windscreen?
options: You can put your phone cradle in any area of the car windscreen
Placing your device cradle on the windscreen swept area you are committing an offence.
Only the swept area of the windscreen can be used as a position for a mobile phone cradle.

questions.question: How to prove that you have a B1 level of ability in the English language?
options: By taking a safety, equality & regulatory understanding assessment at TfL
By passing a B1 test at Trinity or other local colleges
By taking a speaking and listening test at TfL
questions.answer: By passing a B1 test at Trinity or other local colleges

questions.question: Do you need a British Passport to apply to PHV Driver's License?
options: No, but you must have the right to live and work in the UK
Only British or European Union Passports are accepted
questions.answer: No, but you must have the right to live and work in the UK

questions.question: In what circumstances can you ask the passenger to leave your vehicle?
options: When he becomes angry or violent - even in the middle of a motorway
When he becomes angry or violent but only when it is safe to do so
When he asks you to stop at a cashpoint
questions.answer: When he becomes angry or violent but only when it is safe to do so

questions.question: What to do if a visually impaired passenger asks for your license number?
options: Allow them to touch your badge, it includes text in Braille
You don't need to share your license details with passengers
questions.answer: Tell them your license number

questions.question: Do you need to notify TfL about convictions, cautions or arrests?
options: No, the police will inform TfL

Yes, you must tell TfL immediately if you are arrested, charged with, convicted or cautioned for any crime. This includes any fixed notices or road traffic offences that result in penalty points on your driving license.
Yes, but only on your next renewal application
questions.answer: Yes, you must tell TfL immediately if you are arrested, charged with, convicted or cautioned for any crime. This includes any fixed notices or road traffic offences that result in penalty points on your driving license.

questions.question: What must you do if you're disqualified from driving?
options: Inform TfL immediately - keep your badge and license safe at home until the disqualification period ends
Inform TfL immediately and return your driver's license and badge to TfL
Stop driving only - there is no need to notify TfL
questions.answer: Inform TfL immediately and return your driver's license and badge to TfL

questions.question: What is a vehicle inspection?
options: An annual vehicle test done together with an MOT test
An annual vehicle test at one TfL inspection centre to prove that the vehicle meets all the licensing requirements
An annual vehicle test at your main dealer
questions.answer: An annual vehicle test at one TfL inspection centre to prove that the vehicle meets all the licensing requirements

questions.question: Do all private hire vehicles need to display licence discs?
options: No, in some exceptional circumstances the vehicle might be given an exemption
No, only vehicles older than 3 years must display licence discs
questions.answer: No, in some exceptional circumstances the vehicle might be given an exemption

questions.question: Can you carry out private hire bookings when the vehicle licence discs are missing?
options: Yes, but only if it happened within the last 7 days
Yes, but only if it happened within the last 14 days
questions.answer: No

questions.question: Do you need to carry your insurance certificate with you?
options: You should carry details of the vehicle's valid hire or reward insurance policy whenever you are working
You should carry details of the vehicle's valid hire or reward insurance policy at all times
You don't need to carry any proof of your vehicle insurance
questions.answer: You should carry details of the vehicle's valid hire or reward insurance policy whenever you are working

questions.question: When can a replacement vehicle licence disc be issued? (Select 2 correct answers)
options: When you take the original discs off for holiday
When the original discs are lost or stolen
When the original discs are damaged
answer: When the original discs are lost or stolen
When the original discs are damaged

questions.question: Your badge was stolen - you reported this fact to the police and TfL - Can you continue working as a PHV driver?
options: Yes, as long as you have a crime reference letter from the police
No, you cannot continue working without your badge
Yes, but you need to have your paper license with you at all times instead of the badge
questions.answer: No, you cannot continue working without your badge

questions.question: What does the letter which comes with your license contain?
options: Important information about the operator you must work with
Important responsibilities as a London PHV driver, including any conditions you must meet
License will be sent on its own; there are no additional letters
questions.answer: Important responsibilities as a London PHV driver, including any conditions you must meet

questions.question: What is a PHV driver's badge? (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Photographic ID that needs to be kept in your vehicle's glove box at all times
Photographic ID that must be worn at all times when you are working as a PHV driver
Photographic ID that allows your passengers to check the information sent to them by the operator they made a booking with
answer: Photographic ID that must be worn at all times when you are working as a PHV driver
Photographic ID that allows your passengers to check the information sent to them by the operator they made a booking with

questions.question: What does it mean when your license has been suspended?
options: That it has been stopped for a short time and you won't be able to work during this time
That it has been cancelled and you must return it to TfL
That it has been stopped for a short time and you are only allowed to work a limited number of hours per week
questions.answer: That it has been stopped for a short time and you won't be able to work during this time

questions.question: Can you inform members of the public that you are available for hire without a booking?
options: No, PHVs are not allowed to do so

How much you should charge for different journeys.

questions.question: If your passenger decides to change the destination of their journey, asks you to pick up extra passengers, or has extra luggage, you should?
options: Stop your vehicle immediately and inform your operator
Tell your operator as soon as it is safe for you to do so
Charge the passenger extra without informing your operator
questions.answer: Tell your operator as soon as it is safe for you to do so

questions.question: What to do if you refused to carry out a booking?

Carry on and wait for another booking
Only inform the passenger about the reasons of refusal

questions.question: Are PHV drivers allowed to pick people up on the street?
options: No, unless they have booked you through a licensed operator

Must not refuse to take them
Can refuse to carry out the booking - only licensed taxis are required to carry disabled passengers

questions.question: What to do if you're suspicious about any item left behind by a passenger?
options: Call the police immediately and follow their instructions
Throw it away on the street
Take it to your operator's office

questions.question: Are you required to inform your operator about any changes to the booking, for example, if the final destination changes?
options: Yes, you should let the operator know about any changes

questions.question: What are the main reasons to refuse to carry out a booking? (Select 2 correct answers)
options: If the fare is too low

questions.question: Private hire drivers can stop to pick up or drop off passengers in many areas where there are rules in place to limit waiting or stopping. You need to remember that?
options: PHV drivers should not stop on single yellow lines
PHV drivers should not stop in any place where they might stop other vehicles moving or be a danger to other road users

questions.question: What to do if you're waiting for the emergency services with an injured passenger and they suddenly become aggressive or violent towards you?
options: Move somewhere safe, where you can still see the person until the emergency services arrive
